item.title: Air France provides complimentary newspapers and magazines for tablets
item.description: Air France has launched a new app, Air France Press, allowing Flying Blue members to enjoy complimentary digital media offline. Flying Blue members can download a selection of French and international newspapers and magazines at no cost. This content is accessible offline before, during, and after their Air France flights. Passengers can download publications with their ticket, starting 24 hours before their flight until departure. Access to the service is granted by logging into the app using Flying Blue credentials or a reservation number.

item.title: Air France enhances first class experience with new La Première cabins
item.description: Air France launched its new La Première cabin on January 12th, debuting on flight AF254 traveling from Paris-Charles de Gaulle to Singapore and Jakarta. This move emphasizes the airline’s commitment to providing top-tier products and services to its Southeast Asian clientele. Starting in February 2015 and continuing through the winter season, these new cabins will be offered on all daily flights to Singapore and Jakarta. Source: Air France website. Frédéric Gagey, Air France’s Chairman and CEO, stated: “Our objective with the new La Première suites is to offer the absolute best in the market, and that’s what we’re showcasing today.
